scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This document is a March 25, 1848 handwritten notice from Major J. H. Conradof the 58th Regiment of Virginia Militiaordering militiamen within a specified geographical area to assemble at Conrad's Store in Rockingham County[now Elkton--see Nancy Hess, The Heartland: Rockingham County(1976), page 364] on April 1, 1848, for military duty and election of officers. A transcript has been provided for researchers.
According to John W. Wayland, A History of Rockingham County, Virginia(1912), page 451, the 58th Regiment entered state service on July 8, 1813.
